title: Harvard custodians go on strike
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News Over 800 custodians walked off the job demanding fair wage increases.

Sophie Park, File On Monday morning, hundreds of custodians holding purple 32BJ SEIU “Harvard On Strike” signs walked off the job, marching through Harvard Yard in Cambridge and demanding fair wage increases.
The strike began Monday at 10 a.

title: What Mike Vrabel said about missing Milton Williams for the ‘foreseeable future’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Williams is working hard to get back, Vrabel said, but the Patriots will be without him for a while.
Milton Williams.

AP Photo/Gary McCullough FOXBOROUGH – Milton Williams will miss at least four games after the Patriots placed him on injured reserve with a high-ankle sprain, but Mike Vrabel isn’t ready to talk about his season in the past tense.

title: Whitman-Hanson students stage walkout to protest job cuts
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Education The Whitman-Hanson Regional School District is facing a budget deficit of about $1.
39 million.
Whitman-Hanson Regional High School.

title: Student arrested after allegedly bringing airsoft pistol into South Shore high school
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime Braintree High went under a shelter-in-place so an officer and school staff could approach the student.

A Braintree High School student was charged with with carrying a dangerous weapon on school grounds and resisting arrest, among other charges, after allegedly bringing an airsoft gun to school on Monday.
Another student reported to the School Resource Officer early on Monday that they had seen a student with a handgun, according to Braintree Police.

title: Gilley’s Diner in Portsmouth could get a major expansion
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Food News Developer Mark McNabb seeks city approval for food trucks, expanded seating, and building renovations.
Gilley's Diner in 2011.
David Lyon for The Boston Globe Gilley’s Diner, a Portsmouth staple that dates back to 1912, may soon get a major upgrade.

title: On the eve of jury selection, here’s what happened in court in the Brian Walshe case
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Crime Prosecutors faced scrutiny over their decision not to call Walshe’s mother, who hired a private investigator over alleged infidelity.
Brian Walshe, at a past hearing in Norfolk Superior Court.

title: Backlash mounts after Boston University student claims credit for Allston ICE arrests
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Local News “I care deeply about America, American workers, and our future.
My only goal has ever been to keep this country strong and safe,” Zac Segal said Friday.
Allston Car Wash, where nine people were recently detained by ICE agents in an immigration raid.

title: Mass. women’s commission stands by trans appointee amid ‘vicious online attack’
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News The woman received death threats after an article about her appointment spread through "the right-wing media pundit circle," the commission says.
John Tlumacki / The Boston Globe, File In August, Gov.
Maura Healey appointed a transgender woman to the Massachusetts Commission on the Status of Women.
